com.coveros.selenified.element.check.azzert

Class AssertMatches

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coveros.selenified.element.check.azzert.AssertMatches
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Matches

    public class AssertMatches
extends Object
implements Matches
    AssertMatches implements Matches to provide some additional assertion capabilities. It will handle all assertions performed on the actual element. These asserts are custom to the framework, and in addition to providing easy object oriented capabilities, they take screenshots with each assertion to provide additional traceability, and assist in troubleshooting and debugging failing tests. Matches checks that elements have a particular value associated to them that fits the provided regular expression.
    Version:
    3.1.0
    Author:
    Max Saperstone

      • text

        public void text(String expectedPattern)
        Asserts that the element's text matches the regular expression pattern provided. If the element isn't present, this will constitute a failure, same as a mismatch. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.
        Specified by:
        text in interface Matches
        Parameters:
        expectedPattern - the expected pattern of the text of the element

      • text

        public void text(int row,
                 int col,
                 String pattern)
        Asserts that the element's pattern in a particular cell matches the regular expression pattern provided. If the element isn't present, or a table, this will constitute a failure, same as a mismatch. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.
        Specified by:
        text in interface Matches
        Parameters:
        row - - the number of the row in the table - note, row numbering starts at 1, NOT 0
        col - - the number of the column in the table - note, column numbering starts at 1, NOT 0
        pattern - - what pattern do we expect to be in the table cell

      • value

        public void value(String expectedPattern)
        Asserts that the element's value matches the regular expression pattern provided. If the element isn't present or an input, this will constitute a failure, same as a mismatch. This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.
        Specified by:
        value in interface Matches
        Parameters:
        expectedPattern - the expected input value of the element

This information will be logged and recorded, with a screenshot for traceability and added debugging support.

      • isPresentInput

        public boolean isPresentInput(String expected,
                              double waitFor)
        Determines if the element is a present, and if it is, it is an input. Writes out the action and expected outcome to the detailed log. Action is only logged if waitFor is greater than 0 (implying we are waiting)
        Parameters:
        expected - - the expected outcome
        Returns:
        Boolean: whether the element is a select or not

      • isPresentSelect

        public boolean isPresentSelect(String expected,
                               double waitFor)
        Determines if the element is a present, and if it is, it is a select. Writes out the action and expected outcome to the detailed log. Action is only logged if waitFor is greater than 0 (implying we are waiting)
        Parameters:
        expected - - the expected outcome
        Returns:
        Boolean: whether the element is a select or not

      • isPresentTable

        public boolean isPresentTable(String expected,
                              double waitFor)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Boolean: whether the element is an table or not

      • getAttributes

        public String[] getAttributes(String attribute,
                              String expected,
                              double waitFor)
        Retrieves all attributes of an element, and writes out the action and expected result of checking for one particular attribute. Action is only logged if waitFor is greater than 0 (implying we are waiting). If the element isn't present, or the attributes can't be determined an error will be logged and null will be returned
        Parameters:
        attribute - - the attribute to check for
        expected - - is the attribute expected to be present, or not present
        Returns:
        String[]: the list of all attributes from the element;

      • getValue

        public String getValue(String value,
                       String expected,
                       double waitFor)
        Retrieves the value from the element, and writes out the action and value that is being expected. Action is only logged if waitFor is greater than 0 (implying we are waiting). If the element isn't present or an input, an error will be logged and null will be returned
        Parameters:
        value - the expected value of the element
        expected - - is the attribute expected to be present, or not present
        Returns:
        String: the actual value from the input element

      • elementPresent

        public double elementPresent(double seconds)
        Performs a simple check for the element to be present. The provided wait time will be used and the total time the action took will be returned. Nohing will be logged, but this will be used as part of other methods.
        Parameters:
        seconds - - how many seconds to wait for
        Returns:
        double: the time waited
